short_description: This function finds the patterns and calculates different statistical metrics to understand the influence of occurrance of set of items on other.
long_description: This function finds the patterns and calculates different statistical metrics to understand the influence of occurrance of set of items on other.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the input data.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the input data.

argument_clauses.name: TargetColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify the column from the input table which contains the data.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the column from the input table which contains the data.

argument_clauses.name: IDColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the ID column to identify a datapoint(set of rows belong to same data) in a sparse input. Applicable only when isDenseInput is False
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the ID column to identify a datapoint(set of rows belong to same data) in a sparse input. Applicable only when isDenseInput is False

argument_clauses.name: PartitionColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify the name of the input table columns on which to partition the input.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input table columns on which to partition the input.

argument_clauses.name: MaxLen
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of items in item set. The default value is 2.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of items in item set. The default value is 2.

argument_clauses.name: Delimiter
argument_clauses.rDescription: A character or string separates words in the input text. The default value is the comma. Applicable only when isDenseInput is True.
argument_clauses.description: A character or string separates words in the input text. The default value is the comma. Applicable only when isDenseInput is True.

argument_clauses.name: isDenseInput
argument_clauses.rDescription: A Boolean value that specifies whether the input to the function is in dense format. Default is false (sparse format).
argument_clauses.description: A Boolean value that specifies whether the input to the function is in dense format. Default is false (sparse format).

argument_clauses.name: PatternsOrRules
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify whether to emit PATTERNS or RULES as output.
argument_clauses.description: Specify whether to emit PATTERNS or RULES as output.

argument_clauses.name: Support
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify the support value (minimum occurrance threshold) of itemset.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the support value (minimum occurrance threshold) of itemset.
